标记，标点：测量用的标志
圆锥：长形银制或古塔波胶制圆锥，用于根管填塞
逐点比较法, point-to-point comparison method 采用正弦激励，在频率测量范围内所选频率点，逐点测量被测传感器频率响应并与标准传感器响应相比较的方法。
点到点控制系统, point-to-point control system 只是使运动由某一点到达另一指定的点，而不对运动的路径进行控制的一种数值控制系统。
边傍,网片边缘纵向相邻两根目脚组成的结构。

sentence.Network_en: The turning point in the process of growing up is when you discover the core of strength within you that survives all hurt.
sentence.Network_cn: 当你从内心深处找到一种可以忍受一切痛苦的坚强力量时，你的成长历程就会出现飞跃。

sentence.Network_en: I don't see the point in it really. It's just stupid.
sentence.Network_cn: 我真的不理解这到底有什么意义，简直是愚蠢透顶。

sentence.Network_en: It got to the point where he had to leave.
sentence.Network_cn: 到了他不得不走的地步。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 在各部分；在各方面；完全地

jx.jx_en_mean: an instance or example that illustrates what is being discussed

lj.lj_ly: the ‘green revolution’ in agriculture is a good case in point.
lj.lj_ls: 农业上的“绿色革命”就是一个很好的恰当例子。

lj.lj_ly: the ‘green revolution’ in agriculture is a good case in point.
lj.lj_ls: 农业上的“绿色革命”就是一个很好的恰当例子。

jx.jx_en_mean: put across a proposition clearly and convincingly
jx.jx_cn_mean: （清楚地，有说服力地）阐明观点

jx.jx_en_mean: openly accuse someone or apportion blame
the point in a journey or enterprise at which it becomes essential or more practical to continue to the end
a sailing boat's heading in relation to the wind
deliberately make oneself appear superior to someone else by making clever remarks

lj.lj_ly: she was constantly trying to think of ways to score points off him.
lj.lj_ls: 她不断想法子占他的欺头。

jx.jx_en_mean: (chiefly Brit.)accept the validity of someone's idea or argument
jx.jx_cn_mean: (主英)接受某人的观点（或立场）

jx.jx_en_mean: to some extent but not completely
(Boxing)win by scoring more points than one's opponent (as awarded by the judges and/or the referee) rather than by a knockout

jx.jx_en_mean: [reporting verb]say something to make someone aware of a fact or circumstance

lj.lj_ly: [with clause]she pointed out that his van had been in the car park all day.
lj.lj_ls: 她指出他的小货车一整天都在停车场。

lj.lj_ly: [with direct speech]‘Most of the people round here are very poor,’ I pointed out.
lj.lj_ls: 我指出，“这里的人多数都很穷。”。

jx.jx_en_mean: Irrelevant to the matter at hand.

means.word_mean: 指出;表示
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: the noun partly from Old French point, from Latin punctum 'something that is pricked', giving rise to the senses 'unit, mark, point in space or time'; partly from Old French pointe, from Latin puncta 'pricking', giving rise to the senses 'sharp tip, promontory'. The verb is from Old French pointer, and in some senses from the English noun

encyclopedia.content: 有尖,尖端,尖头； (空间的)一点,处,地方,位置；特点,特征；时间上的一点,(特定)时刻;瞬间；分数;；思想;论点等意思。在具体语境中有不同意思与用法。

entry.def: You use point to refer to something that someone has said or written.

example.ex: We disagree with every point Mr Blunkett makes...
example.tran: 布伦基特先生提出的观点我们一个都不同意。

example.ex: Dave Hill's article makes the right point about the Taylor Report...
example.tran: 戴夫·希尔的文章对《泰勒报告》的看法是正确的。

entry.def: If you say that someone has a point, or if you take their point, you mean that you accept that what they have said is important and should be considered.

example.ex: 'If he'd already killed once, surely he'd have killed Sarah?' She had a point there...
example.tran: “如果他杀过一次人，那他一定已经杀了萨拉吧？”她说得有道理。

example.ex: Oh I take your point, John, about that.
example.tran: 噢，约翰，关于那一点，我觉得你说得对。

entry.def: The point of what you are saying or discussing is the most important part that provides a reason or explanation for the rest.

example.ex: 'Did I ask you to talk to me?' — 'That's not the point.'...
example.tran: “我请你跟我谈了吗？”——“问题不在这儿。”

example.ex: The American Congress and media mostly missed the point about all this.
example.tran: 美国国会和媒体大都没搞清这一切的核心问题。

entry.def: If you ask what the point of something is, or say that there is no point in it, you are indicating that a particular action has no purpose or would not be useful.

example.ex: What was the point of thinking about him?...
example.tran: 想他有什么用呢？

example.ex: There was no point in staying any longer.
example.tran: 再留下来就没有意义了。

entry.def: A point is a detail, aspect, or quality of something or someone.

example.ex: Many of the points in the report are correct...
example.tran: 报告中的很多细节是正确的。

example.ex: The most interesting point about the village was its religion...
example.tran: 这个村庄最有意思的地方就是它的宗教。

entry.tran: 地点；地方；（表示位置的）点，处
entry.def: A point is a particular place or position where something happens.

example.ex: As a mark of respect the emperor met him at a point several weeks' march from the capital...
example.tran: 出于尊重，皇帝在离首都还有几个星期路程的地方迎接了他。

example.ex: The pain originated from a point in his right thigh.
example.tran: 疼痛是从他右大腿的某处开始的。

entry.def: You use point to refer to a particular time, or to a particular stage in the development of something.

example.ex: We're all going to die at some point...
example.tran: 我们都将在某个时间死去。

example.ex: At one point, around 70,000 members had failed to pay...
example.tran: 一度曾有约7万名成员没有支付费用。

entry.def: The point of something such as a pin, needle, or knife is the thin, sharp end of it.
In spoken English, you use point to refer to the dot or mark in a decimal number that separates the whole numbers from the fractions.

example.ex: This is FM stereo one oh three point seven...
example.tran: 这里是调频立体声103.7。

example.ex: Inflation at nine point four percent is the worst for eight years.
example.tran: 9.4%的通货膨胀率是8年来最糟的。

entry.tran: （用作某些体育运动等计分单位的）点，分
entry.def: In some sports, competitions, and games, a point is one of the single marks that are added together to give the total score.

example.ex: They lost the 1977 World Cup final to Australia by a single point...
example.tran: 他们在1977年的世界杯决赛中仅以一分之差输给了澳大利亚队。

example.ex: Chamberlain scored 50 or more points four times in the season.
example.tran: 张伯伦在赛季中有4次得分不低于50。

entry.def: The points of the compass are directions such as North, South, East, and West.

example.ex: Sightseers arrived from all points of the compass.
example.tran: 观光者来自四面八方。

entry.def: On a railway track, the points are the levers and rails at a place where two tracks join or separate. The points enable a train to move from one track to another.

example.ex: ...the rattle of the wheels across the points.
example.tran: 驶过道岔的车轮发出的哐啷哐啷声

entry.def: A point is an electric socket.

example.ex: ...too far away from the nearest electrical point.
example.tran: 离最近的电掣位也太远

entry.def: If you point at a person or thing, you hold out your finger towards them in order to make someone notice them.

example.ex: I pointed at the boy sitting nearest me...
example.tran: 我指了指坐得离我最近的男孩。

example.ex: He pointed at me with the stem of his pipe...
example.tran: 他用烟斗柄指着我。

entry.def: If you point something at someone, you aim the tip or end of it towards them.

example.ex: David Khan pointed his finger at Mary...
example.tran: 戴维·卡恩用手指指着玛丽。

example.ex: A man pointed a gun at them and pulled the trigger.
example.tran: 一名男子用手枪指着他们，扣动了扳机。

entry.def: If something points to a place or points in a particular direction, it shows where that place is or it faces in that direction.

example.ex: An arrow pointed to the toilets...
example.tran: 箭头指向卫生间。

example.ex: You can go anywhere and still the compass points north or south...
example.tran: 无论走到哪里，罗盘仍然指向北或南。

entry.def: If something points to a particular situation, it suggests that the situation exists or is likely to occur.

example.ex: Earlier reports pointed to pupils working harder, more continuously, and with enthusiasm...
example.tran: 早些时候的报告显示学生学习更为刻苦、持久，并且怀有学习热情。

example.ex: Private polls and embassy reports pointed to a no vote.
example.tran: 私人民意调查和使馆报告表明投票结果将会是否决。

entry.tran: 着重指出；强调；以…为证明
entry.def: If you point to something that has happened or that is happening, you are using it as proof that a particular situation exists.

example.ex: George Fodor points to other weaknesses in the way the campaign has progressed...
example.tran: 乔治·福多尔以运动开展过程中的其他不足为证。

example.ex: Gooch last night pointed to their bowling as the key to World Cup success.
example.tran: 古奇昨晚指出，他们的投球是在世界杯上取得成功的关键。

entry.tran: （用水泥等）勾嵌（砖或石墙的砌缝）
entry.def: When builders point a wall, they put a substance such as cement into the gaps between the bricks or stones in order to make the wall stronger and seal it.
If you say that something is beside the point, you mean that it is not relevant to the subject that you are discussing.

example.ex: Brian didn't like it, but that was beside the point.
example.tran: 布赖恩不喜欢它，但那并不重要。

entry.tran: 谈到正题；讲到关键问题
entry.def: When someone comes to the point or gets to the point, they start talking about the thing that is most important to them.

example.ex: He came to the point at once. 'You did a splendid job on this case.'...
example.tran: 他立刻切入正题道：“这件案子你处理得很棒。”

example.ex: Was she ever going to get to the point?
example.tran: 她到底还会不会讲到重点？

entry.def: If you make your point or prove your point, you prove that something is true, either by arguing about it or by your actions or behaviour.

example.ex: I think you've made your point, dear...
example.tran: 亲爱的，我想你已证明你的观点了。

example.ex: Dr David McCleland, of Boston University, studied one-hundred people, aged eighteen to sixty, to prove the point...
example.tran: 为证明这一点，波士顿大学的戴维·麦克莱兰博士对100名年龄在18至60岁之间的人进行了研究。

entry.def: If you make a point of doing something, you do it in a very deliberate or obvious way.

example.ex: She made a point of spending as much time as possible away from Osborne House.
example.tran: 她特意尽可能地不呆在奥斯本庄园。

entry.def: If you are on the point of doing something, you are about to do it.

example.ex: He was on the point of saying something when the phone rang...
example.tran: 他正要说话时电话铃响了。

example.ex: She looked on the point of tears.
example.tran: 她看起来就要哭了。

entry.def: Something that is to the point is relevant to the subject that you are discussing, or expressed neatly without wasting words or time.

example.ex: Mr. Baker was smiling and to the point...
example.tran: 贝克先生微笑着，说得很中肯。

example.ex: The description which he had been given was brief and to the point.
example.tran: 给他的描述言简意赅。

entry.def: If you say that something is true up to a point, you mean that it is partly but not completely true.

example.ex: 'Was she good?' — 'Mmm. Up to a point.'
example.tran: “她行不行？”——“嗯，某种程度上来说还可以。”

example.ex: It worked up to a point.
example.tran: 它起了一定作用。

means.word_mean: 1. a geometric element that has position but no extension;

sentences.sentence: "a point is defined by its coordinates"

means.word_mean: 2. the precise location of something; a spatially limited location;

sentences.sentence: "she walked to a point where she could survey the whole street"

means.word_mean: 3. a brief version of the essential meaning of something;

sentences.sentence: "get to the point"
"he missed the point of the joke"
"life has lost its point"

means.word_mean: 4. a specific identifiable position in a continuum or series or especially in a process;

sentences.sentence: "a remarkable degree of frankness"
"at what stage are the social sciences?"

means.word_mean: 5. an isolated fact that is considered separately from the whole;

sentences.sentence: "several of the details are similar"
"a point of information"

means.word_mean: 6. an instant of time;

sentences.sentence: "at that point I had to leave"

means.word_mean: 7. the object of an activity;

sentences.sentence: "what is the point of discussing it?"

means.word_mean: 8. a V shape;

sentences.sentence: "the cannibal's teeth were filed to sharp points"

means.word_mean: 9. a very small circular shape;

sentences.sentence: "a row of points"
"draw lines between the dots"

means.word_mean: 10. the unit of counting in scoring a game or contest;

sentences.sentence: "he scored 20 points in the first half"
"a touchdown counts 6 points"

means.word_mean: 11. a promontory extending out into a large body of water;

sentences.sentence: "they sailed south around the point"

means.word_mean: 12. a distinct part that can be specified separately in a group of things that could be enumerated on a list;

sentences.sentence: "he noticed an item in the New York Times"
"she had several items on her shopping list"
"the main point on the agenda was taken up first"

means.word_mean: 13. a style in speech or writing that arrests attention and has a penetrating or convincing quality or effect
14. an outstanding characteristic;

sentences.sentence: "his acting was one of the high points of the movie"

means.word_mean: 15. sharp end;

sentences.sentence: "he stuck the point of the knife into a tree"
"he broke the point of his pencil"

means.word_mean: 16. any of 32 horizontal directions indicated on the card of a compass;

sentences.sentence: "he checked the point on his compass"

means.word_mean: 17. a linear unit used to measure the size of type; approximately 1/72 inch
18. a punctuation mark (.) placed at the end of a declarative sentence to indicate a full stop or after abbreviations;

sentences.sentence: "in England they call a period a stop"

means.word_mean: 19. a V-shaped mark at one end of an arrow pointer;

sentences.sentence: "the point of the arrow was due north"

means.word_mean: 20. the property of a shape that tapers to a sharp point
21. a distinguishing or individuating characteristic;

sentences.sentence: "he knows my bad points as well as my good points"

means.word_mean: 22. the gun muzzle's direction;

sentences.sentence: "he held me up at the point of a gun"

means.word_mean: 23. a wall socket
24. a contact in the distributor; as the rotor turns its projecting arm contacts distributor points and current flows to the spark plugs
1. indicate a place, direction, person, or thing; either spatially or figuratively;

sentences.sentence: "I showed the customer the glove section"
"He pointed to the empty parking space"
"he indicated his opponents"

means.word_mean: 2. be oriented;

sentences.sentence: "The weather vane points North"

means.word_mean: 3. direct into a position for use;

sentences.sentence: "point a gun"
"He charged his weapon at me"

means.word_mean: 4. direct the course; determine the direction of travelling
5. be a signal for or a symptom of;

sentences.sentence: "These symptoms indicate a serious illness"
"Her behavior points to a severe neurosis"
"The economic indicators signal that the euro is undervalued"

means.word_mean: 6. sail close to the wind
7. mark (Hebrew words) with diacritics
8. mark with diacritics;

sentences.sentence: "point the letter"

means.word_mean: 9. mark (a psalm text) to indicate the points at which the music changes
10. be positionable in a specified manner;

sentences.sentence: "The gun points with ease"

means.word_mean: 11. intend (something) to move towards a certain goal;

sentences.sentence: "He aimed his fists towards his opponent's face"
"criticism directed at her superior"
"direct your anger towards others, not towards yourself"

means.word_mean: 12. give a point to;

sentences.sentence: "The candles are tapered"

means.word_mean: 13. repair the joints of bricks;

sentences.sentence: "point a chimney"

point点,变尖,指,针→n.点, 尖端, 分数 v.弄尖,指向,指出 v.指

Sentence.sentence: But functioning fireplaces remain to this day a powerful selling point in a house or apartment.
For example, a Colombian who wants someone to approach him often signals with a hand movement in which all the fingers of one hand, cupped, point downward as they move rapidly back and forth.

Kodak's decision to file for bankruptcy（破产）protection is a sad, though not unexpected, turning point for a leading American corporation that pioneered consumer photography and dominated the film market for decades, but ultimately failed to adapt to the digital revolution

means.word_mean: 要点, 重点, 核心问题, 论点, 观点, 见解

sentences.en: Some of these points will have to be further elaborated as we go along.
sentences.cn: 这些要点中, 有些我们在往下讨论时还得作进一步的详细阐述。

means.word_mean: 尖端; 尖儿; 尖头

sentences.en: When you buy new pens, get one with a sharper point.
sentences.cn: 买新钢笔时要买尖儿比较尖的。

means.word_mean: 点; 小数点

sentences.en: When we read out 4.23, we say “four point two three”.

means.word_mean: 分数, 得分

sentences.en: He conceded ten points to his opponent.
sentences.cn: 他让给自己的对手十分。

means.word_mean: 目的, 意图, 理由

sentences.en: If you have a definite purpose in mind, get to the point promptly.
sentences.cn: 如果你心里有明确的意图, 就干脆说出来。

means.word_mean: 条款; 细目; 具体细节（或事实）

sentences.en: There is another point to be borne in mind.
sentences.cn: 另外一项条款是应当记住的。

means.word_mean: 削尖

sentences.en: Point this pencil for me, please.

means.word_mean: 增强

sentences.en: He told a story to point his advice.
sentences.cn: 他讲了一个故事, 以增强他的忠告的力量。

means.word_mean: 指; 指向
(为对付某一对手而)进行强化训练(for)

sentences.en: The team was pointing for the game with the neighbouring school.
sentences.cn: 全队秣马厉兵准备同邻校比赛。

jushi.english: To go back to the point you have just mentioned is worthless.
jushi.chinese: 再回头来谈论你的论点是毫无价值的。

jushi.english: He insisted that we should call in a specialist at this point.
jushi.chinese: 这时他坚决主张我们去请一位专家来。

jushi.english: Several times he almost brought himself to the point of speaking to them, but his courage failed him.
jushi.chinese: 好几次他几乎就要和他们去说了,但又没有勇气了。
